1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 ''' Inputs
3  /move_base_simple/goal geometry_msgs/PoseStamped
4  /some_map_topic nav_msgs/OccupancyGrid Assuming this is a latched topic
5  /some_odom_topic nav_msgs/Odometry
6 
7  Output
8  /path nav_msgs/Path
9 '''

34 class PathPlannerNode:
35  def __init__(self):
36 
37  # ===================== Initialization ========================
38 
39  # init grid arrays
40  self.sgrid = None # static grid
41  self.ogrid = None # obstacle grid
42  self.costMap = CostMap()
43 
44  # other init variables
45  self.goalPoint = None
46  self.searchSA = None
47  self.odom = None
48  self.planCounter = 0
49 
50  # ======= States =========
51  # StaticLayer published? yes/no
52  # ObstacleLayer published? yes/no
53  # Global Path gen? yes/no
54  # Replanned once? yes/no
55  self.pathGlobalGen = False
56  self.pathReplanOnce = False
57 
58  self.subOGM = rospy.Subscriber("/test/map", OccupancyGrid, self.callback_OGM)
59  self.subGoal = rospy.Subscriber("/move_base_simple/goal", PoseStamped, self.callback_Goal)
60 
61  self.subOdom = rospy.Subscriber("/test/odom", Odometry, self.callback_Odom)
62  self.subOdom = rospy.Subscriber("/test/fallback_odom", Odometry, self.callback_Odom)
63  self.pubPath = rospy.Publisher("/test/path", Path, queue_size=1, latch=True)
64 
65  #TODO Consider publishing total cost map for debug visualization purposes
66  self.pubCostMap = rospy.Publisher("/test/full_map", OccupancyGrid, queue_size=1, latch=True)
67 
68  # Obstacle detection with <ObjectDetectArray>
69  # #/test/object_detection
70  self.subObjectDetect = rospy.Subscriber("/test/object_detection", ObjectDetectArray, self.callback_OD)
71 
72  # CALL IN MAIN
73  def publish_full_map(self):
74  '''Publishes an OccupancyGrid type message'''
75 
76  print("Publishing Full Map")
77  rate = rospy.Rate(5)
78  # empty grid / pose messages for speed?
79  self.ogmMsg = OccupancyGrid()
80  pose = Pose()
81 
82  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
83  if self.costMap.does_layer_exist(['StaticLayer', 'ObstacleLayer']):
84  fullMap = self.costMap.return_total_map()
85  m, n = fullMap.shape
86  self.ogmMsg.header.seq += 1
87  self.ogmMsg.header.stamp = rospy.get_rostime()
88  self.ogmMsg.header.frame_id = self.mapFrameID
89 
90  # Fill in meta data
91  self.ogmMsg.info.map_load_time = self.ogmMsg.header.stamp
92  self.ogmMsg.info.resolution = self.grid_size
93  self.ogmMsg.info.width = n #cells
94  self.ogmMsg.info.height = m #cells
95  # fill in pose data for origin
96  pose.position.x = self.origin[0]
97  pose.position.y = self.origin[1]
98  pose.orientation.w = 1
99  self.ogmMsg.info.origin = pose
100  # Flatten numpy array row-majored
101  #pdb.set_trace()
102  self.ogmMsg.data = fullMap.flatten('C').astype(np.int8).tolist()
103  self.pubCostMap.publish(self.ogmMsg)
104  rate.sleep()
105 
106  def publish_path(self, path):
107  ''' Publish a nav_msgs/Path message latched topic '''
108  # TODO: Insanely slow, need to replace loop someday
109  self.pathMsg = Path()
110  self.pathMsg.header.seq +=1
111  self.pathMsg.header.stamp = rospy.get_rostime()
112  self.pathMsg.header.frame_id = self.mapFrameID
113  for ndx, p in enumerate(path):
114  ps = PoseStamped()
115  ps.header.seq = ndx
116  ps.header.frame_id = self.mapFrameID
117  #ps.header.stamp = rospy.get_rostime()
118 
119  ps.pose.position.x = p[0]
120  ps.pose.position.y = p[1]
121  self.pathMsg.poses.append(ps)
122 
123  self.pubPath.publish(self.pathMsg)
124 
125 
126  def re_plan(self):
127  ''' Replan only segments which have an obstacle, and after generating a new path '''
128  if self.pathGlobalGen:
129 
130  # Detect path in obstacles (collision)
131  fullmap = self.costMap.return_total_map()
132  indx, indy = get_index(self.path[:,0], self.path[:,1], self.grid_size, self.grid_dim)
133  #fullmap[ind[1], ind[0]]
134  # Maskbit true if an obstacle (100) and TODO beyond some distance
135  #mask = (fullmap[ind[1], ind[0]]==100)
136  mask = np.diff(fullmap[indy, indx]>=100, prepend=False)
137  maskTrueInd = np.where(mask==True)
138  offset = 20 # in terms of index
139  try:
140  if len(maskTrueInd[0]) > 0:
141  # TODO: Find a better way to modify the indCor here to be further away
142  offsetMask = np.zeros_like(mask)
143  offsetMaskInd = [np.clip(maskTrueInd[0][0] - offset, 0, len(mask)-1 ), np.clip(maskTrueInd[0][1]+offset, 0, len(mask)-1)]
144 
145  offsetMask[offsetMaskInd] = True
146  # Stack indices
147  #indCor = np.vstack((indx[mask],indy[mask])).T
148  indCor = np.vstack((indx[offsetMask], indy[offsetMask])).T
149 
150  # Convert to worldcor
151  worldCorX, worldCorY = get_world(indCor[:,0], indCor[:,1], self.grid_size, self.grid_dim)
152 
153  # look for places that change using np.diff
154  #maskdiff = (np.diff(mask)==True)
155  #fullmap[ind[1][maskdiff], ind[0][maskdiff]]
156 
157  # Pad the truth?
158  #maskTrue = np.where(mask==True)
159 
160  # introduce for loop for multiple obstacles (each obstacle has an entering and exiting segment) (each obstacle has 2 trues)
161  #startPoint = (worldCorX[0], worldCorY[0])
162  startInd = get_index(self.odom[0], self.odom[1], self.grid_size, self.grid_dim)
163  startPoint = get_world(startInd[0], startInd[1], self.grid_size, self.grid_dim)
164  goalPoint = (worldCorX[1], worldCorY[1])
165 
166  # Then replan if needed
167  self.searchSA_replan = AStarSearch(self.squareGridGraphTotal, startPoint, goalPoint, h_type='euclidean', inflation=5.0, visualize=rc.visualize)
168  #startTime = time.time() #Start timer
169  parents, g = self.searchSA_replan.use_algorithm()
170  newSegment = reconstruct_path(parents, startPoint, goalPoint)
171  #finishTime = time.time() - startTime
172 
173  # insert new segment into global path
174  # self.path[maskTrueInd[0][0]:maskTrueInd[0][1], :] = np.nan
175  # self.path = np.insert(self.path, maskTrueInd[0][0]+1, newSegment, 0)
176  #self.path[offsetMaskInd[0]:offsetMaskInd[1], :] = np.nan
177  #self.path = np.insert(self.path, offsetMaskInd[0]+1, newSegment, 0)
178  #self.path = self.path[~np.isnan(self.path).any(axis=1)] #remove nans
179  self.path = np.vstack((newSegment, self.path[offsetMaskInd[1]:-1]))
180  self.publish_path(self.path)
181 
182 # self.publish_path(newSegment)
183  self.planCounter += 1
184  #print(self.planCounter, "REPLANNING")
185  #print(maskTrueInd)
186  except Exception as err:
187  print(err)
188  pdb.set_trace()
189 
190 
191  def get_plan(self):
192  '''
193  Applies Astar algorithm and returns a linked list 'parent' and cost hash table g.
194  Called when new goal is given
195  '''
196  # Need to find the nearest cell in grid
197  ind = get_index(self.goalPoint[0], self.goalPoint[1], self.grid_size, self.grid_dim)
198  goalFilt = get_world(ind[0], ind[1], self.grid_size, self.grid_dim)
199 
200  # Need to find the nearest cell in grid
201  ind = get_index(self.odom[0], self.odom[1], self.grid_size, self.grid_dim)
202  odomFilt = get_world(ind[0], ind[1], self.grid_size, self.grid_dim)
203 
204  # Create Search object and use it! Also Time it. TODO Reverse Search Direction
205  self.searchSA = AStarSearch(self.squareGridGraphStatic, odomFilt, goalFilt, h_type='euclidean', inflation=1.0, visualize=rc.visualize)
206 
207  # debug
208  if self.searchSA.visualize:
209  self.fig = plt.figure(1)
210  self.ax = self.fig.gca()
211  plt.axis('equal')
212  self.ax.clear()
213  self.im = self.ax.imshow(self.costMap.return_total_map(), origin='lower', extent=[self.minX, self.maxX, self.minY, self.maxY])
214 
215  startTime = time.time() #Start timer
216  self.parents, self.g = self.searchSA.use_algorithm()
217  self.path = reconstruct_path(self.parents, odomFilt, goalFilt)
218  finishTime = time.time() - startTime #get finish time
219 
220  # Publish
221  self.publish_path(self.path)
222  print("GOT A NEW PLAN in %f secs" % finishTime)
223 
224  self.pathGlobalGen = True
225

229  def callback_Odom(self, msg):
230  '''
231  expects an Odometry message
232  '''
233  self.odom = (msg.pose.pose.position.x, msg.pose.pose.position.y)
234 
235 
236  #self.counter+=1
237  #print("GOT NEW ODOM POINT", self.counter)
238 
239  def callback_Goal(self, msg):
240  '''
241  expects a PoseStamped message
242  '''
243  # Get prefiltered goal point
244  self.goalPoint = (msg.pose.position.x, msg.pose.position.y)
245 
246  #print
247  print("GOT A NEW GOAL POINT", self.goalPoint)
248 
249  if self.odom is not None and self.goalPoint is not None:
250  self.get_plan()
251 
252  def callback_OGM(self, msg):
253  '''
254  expects an OccupancyGrid Message
255 
256  (Trinary values)
257  If p > occupied_thresh, output the value 100 to indicate the cell is occupied.
258  If p < free_thresh, output the value 0 to indicate the cell is free.
259  Otherwise, output -1 a.k.a. 255 (as an unsigned char), to indicate that the cell is unknown.
260 
261  '''
262  # Consider ogrid to binary ogm, but using trinary values should still work
263  self.sgrid = np.array(msg.data).reshape((msg.info.height, msg.info.width))
264  self.origin = np.array([msg.info.origin.position.x, msg.info.origin.position.y])
265  self.mapFrameID = msg.header.frame_id
266 
267  # Boundaries of map in physical coordinates
268  self.minX = self.origin[0]
269  self.maxX = msg.info.resolution * msg.info.width + self.origin[0] - 1
270  self.minY = self.origin[1]
271  self.maxY = msg.info.resolution * msg.info.height + self.origin[1] - 1
272 
273  # Set all unknowns (-1) to occupied (100)
274  self.sgrid[(self.sgrid==-1)] = 100
275 
276  # ================== Consider Rebinning here ========================#
277 
278  #factor = 2
279  # newShape = (msg.info.height//factor, msg.info.width//factor)
280  # rebin(self.ogrid, newShape)
281  #self.ogrid = bin_ndarray(self.ogrid, (msg.info.height//factor, msg.info.width//factor))
282 
283  newRes = 1
284  ksize = np.round(newRes/msg.info.resolution).astype(int)
285  self.sgrid = pooling(self.sgrid, (ksize, ksize), pad=False)
286 
287  # store some pertinent values for reuse
288  self.grid_dim = (self.minX, self.maxX, self.minY, self.maxY)
289  #self.grid_size = msg.info.resolution
290  self.grid_size = newRes
291 
292  # update layer (note that we can directly manipulate layer variable )
293  # or manipulate self.sgrid directly!
294  if not self.costMap.does_layer_exist("StaticLayer"):
295  self.costMap.add_layer(self.sgrid, name="StaticLayer")
296 
297  # use SquareGrid class, "pointers" in use! Generate a good global plan on the sgrid
298  self.squareGridGraphStatic = SquareGrid(self.sgrid, grid_dim=self.grid_dim, grid_size=self.grid_size, type_=8)
299  #self.squareGridGraph = SquareGrid(self.costMap.return_total_map(), grid_dim=self.grid_dim, grid_size=self.grid_size, type_=8)
300 
301  print("GOT A NEW MAP")
302  # (class graph, tuple start, tuple goal, string h_type, bool visualize)
303  if self.odom is not None and self.goalPoint is not None:
304  self.get_plan()
305 
306  def callback_OD(self, msg):
307  '''
308  Expects an ObjectDetectArray, which is a list of ObjectDetect's
309  # cur_det = ObjectDetect()
310  # cur_det.easting = 100
311  # cur_det.northing = 300
312  # cur_det.id = 134
313  # cur_det.bb_height = 25
314  # cur_det.bb_width = 25
315  # cur_det.obj_confidence = 1
316 
317  currently assumes like frame of map
318  '''
319 
320  # TODO: DO SOME FRAME TRANSFORMATIONS HERE TOO
321  # TODO: IF no updates, clear the obstacles from self.ogrid
322  # TODO: Error handling if detection is outside of the map!
323 
324  # Only Add a layer once, then update the existing layer subsequently
325  # obstacle layer has to be the same grid size, grid dim as static layer
326  if not self.costMap.does_layer_exist("ObstacleLayer") and self.costMap.does_layer_exist("StaticLayer"):
327 
328  self.ind_func = lambda d: get_index(d[0],d[1], self.grid_size, self.grid_dim)
329  self.ogrid = np.zeros_like(self.sgrid)
330  self.costMap.add_layer(self.ogrid, "ObstacleLayer")
331  print("Added Obstacle Layer")
332  elif self.costMap.does_layer_exist(["StaticLayer","ObstacleLayer" ]):
333  self.ogrid[:] = np.zeros_like(self.sgrid)
334  for od in msg.detections:
335  # od is an ObjectDetect message type
336 
337  cx = od.easting
338  cy = od.northing
339 
340  # Corners of bounding box
341  topLeft = (cx - od.bb_width/2, cy + od.bb_height/2)
342  topRight = (cx + od.bb_width/2, cy + od.bb_height/2)
343  bottomLeft = (cx - od.bb_width/2, cy - od.bb_height/2)
344  bottomRight = (cx + od.bb_width/2, cy - od.bb_height/2)
345 
346  # Everything in the bounding box is an obstacle!
347  mapInd = list(map(self.ind_func, (topLeft, topRight, bottomLeft, bottomRight)))
348  minInd, maxInd = min(mapInd), max(mapInd)
349  self.ogrid[minInd[1]:maxInd[1], minInd[0]:maxInd[0]] = 100.0
350 
351  self.squareGridGraphTotal = SquareGrid(self.costMap.return_total_map(), grid_dim=self.grid_dim, grid_size=self.grid_size, type_=8)
352  self.re_plan()
353 
354 if __name__=="__main__":
355  rospy.init_node("planner_test_node")
356  ppn = PathPlannerNode()
357 
358  if rc.visualize:
359  plt.show(block=False) #Debug plotter may not work properly
360 
361  ppn.publish_full_map()
362 
363  rospy.spin() #may be unncessary
